events.message: The insured has reported a collision involving their vehicle on April 30th, providing initial details of the accident location and severity.
The claim has been categorized under Auto Accident based on the keywords in the initial report mentioning a car accident and damage.
An insurance agent was assigned to this auto accident claim to assist the customer through the next steps and investigations.
The insurance company formally acknowledged receipt of the vehicle accident claim and assured customer of timely processing.
Customer was asked to submit photos of the vehicle damage, police report, and driver's license to proceed with the auto accident claim.
All requested documents including accident photos and the official police report were successfully submitted by the insured.
Investigation of the auto accident claim commenced with an insurance adjuster reviewing the evidence and police documentation.
The investigation concluded with confirmation that the insured was not at fault, and all submitted evidence supported this finding.
A settlement offer was proposed to the insured covering full repair costs of the vehicle as assessed by the claim adjuster.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and appreciated the speed and clarity in communication.
Official claim approval granted following customer's agreement to the settlement terms and notice of prompt payment was issued.
The insurance payment covering vehicle repairs was processed and disbursed to the customerâ€™s account promptly.
The auto accident claim has been officially closed after payment issuance and confirmation of repair completion by the insured.
